title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 80-7.6 - Apparatus required
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 80-7.6 - Apparatus required

State Regulations
(a) Test cabinet. A test cabinet similar to that shown in Figure IV shall be
used. (b) Support frame. A support
frame conforming to Figure II shall be used. It shall be constructed of 1/8
inch steel. (c) Hold-down plate. A
hold-down plate conforming to Figure III shall be used. It shall be constructed
of 1/8 inch steel. (d) Spacers and
clamps. A spacer and clamping arrangement shall be used which is capable of
positioning the hold-down plate with its bottom surface one inch above the top
surface of the support frame, so that it holds the test specimen at a one-inch
thickness on the two sides and the back. (e) Thread. #50 white mercerized cotton
thread. (f) Tape. Tape for
fastening the thread to the frame. Note:Alternate methods of accomplishing this, such as
small clips, may also be used. (g) Weights. Weights for attachment to the
timing threads. Note:Small clamp-type paper clips work well as
weights. (h) Burner. A
Bunsen burner with a tube of 3/8 inch inside diameter shall be used. The gas
adjusting valve is set to provide a flame, with the tube vertical, 11/2 inches
in height. The air inlet to the burner is closed. (i) Gas. The gas used shall be Matheson

Manufactured Gas Type B or equivalent. (j) Stop watch. A stop watch or other timing
device shall be used capable of measuring the burning time to 0.2
second. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
80-7.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
